# overrideUserInterfaceStyle

**Instance Property**

The specific user interface style to apply to the tool picker.

## Declaration

```swift
var overrideUserInterfaceStyle: UIUserInterfaceStyle { get set }
```

## Discussion

If you set this property, consider if you need to set [doc://com.apple.pencilkit/documentation/PencilKit/PKToolPicker/colorUserInterfaceStyle] to a select a different user interface style. The default user interface style is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/UIKit/UIUserInterfaceStyle/unspecified].

## Customizing picker behavior

- **isRulerActive**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the ruler is visible on the canvas.
- **colorUserInterfaceStyle**: The user interface style for the tool picker.
- **showsDrawingPolicyControls**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the default drawing policy UI is visible.
- **stateAutosaveName**: The name used to automatically save the tool picker’s state in the defaults system.
